verses.name: Job 41:1
verses.text: Canst thou draw out leviathan with an hook? or his tongue with a cord which thou lettest down?

verses.name: Job 41:2
verses.text: Canst thou put an hook into his nose? or bore his jaw through with a thorn?

verses.name: Job 41:3
verses.text: Will he make many supplications unto thee? will he speak soft words unto thee?

verses.name: Job 41:4
verses.text: Will he make a covenant with thee? wilt thou take him for a servant for ever?

verses.name: Job 41:5
verses.text: Wilt thou play with him as with a bird? or wilt thou bind him for thy maidens?

verses.name: Job 41:6
verses.text: Shall the companions make a banquet of him? shall they part him among the merchants?

verses.name: Job 41:7
verses.text: Canst thou fill his skin with barbed irons? or his head with fish spears?

verses.name: Job 41:8
verses.text: Lay thine hand upon him, remember the battle, do no more.

verses.name: Job 41:9
verses.text: Behold, the hope of him is in vain: shall not one be cast down even at the sight of him?

verses.name: Job 41:10
verses.text: None is so fierce that dare stir him up: who then is able to stand before me?

verses.name: Job 41:11
verses.text: Who hath prevented me, that I should repay him? whatsoever is under the whole heaven is mine.

verses.name: Job 41:12
verses.text: I will not conceal his parts, nor his power, nor his comely proportion.

verses.name: Job 41:13
verses.text: Who can discover the face of his garment? or who can come to him with his double bridle?

verses.name: Job 41:14
verses.text: Who can open the doors of his face? his teeth are terrible round about.

verses.name: Job 41:15
verses.text: His scales are his pride, shut up together as with a close seal.

verses.name: Job 41:16
verses.text: One is so near to another, that no air can come between them.

verses.name: Job 41:17
verses.text: They are joined one to another, they stick together, that they cannot be sundered.

verses.name: Job 41:18
verses.text: By his neesings a light doth shine, and his eyes are like the eyelids of the morning.

verses.name: Job 41:19
verses.text: Out of his mouth go burning lamps, and sparks of fire leap out.

verses.name: Job 41:20
verses.text: Out of his nostrils goeth smoke, as out of a seething pot or caldron.

verses.name: Job 41:21
verses.text: His breath kindleth coals, and a flame goeth out of his mouth.

verses.name: Job 41:22
verses.text: In his neck remaineth strength, and sorrow is turned into joy before him.

verses.name: Job 41:23
verses.text: The flakes of his flesh are joined together: they are firm in themselves; they cannot be moved.

verses.name: Job 41:24
verses.text: His heart is as firm as a stone; yea, as hard as a piece of the nether millstone.

verses.name: Job 41:25
verses.text: When he raiseth up himself, the mighty are afraid: by reason of breakings they purify themselves.

verses.name: Job 41:26
verses.text: The sword of him that layeth at him cannot hold: the spear, the dart, nor the habergeon.

verses.name: Job 41:27
verses.text: He esteemeth iron as straw, and brass as rotten wood.

verses.name: Job 41:28
verses.text: The arrow cannot make him flee: slingstones are turned with him into stubble.

verses.name: Job 41:29
verses.text: Darts are counted as stubble: he laugheth at the shaking of a spear.

verses.name: Job 41:30
verses.text: Sharp stones are under him: he spreadeth sharp pointed things upon the mire.

verses.name: Job 41:31
verses.text: He maketh the deep to boil like a pot: he maketh the sea like a pot of ointment.

verses.name: Job 41:32
verses.text: He maketh a path to shine after him; one would think the deep to be hoary.

verses.name: Job 41:33
verses.text: Upon earth there is not his like, who is made without fear.

verses.name: Job 41:34
verses.text: He beholdeth all high things: he is a king over all the children of pride.
